Comment 6: 
It is unlikely that there will ever be a permanent pinning solution for allocations in
Go.  The easiest way to permanently pin memory is to allocate it in C, which of course
requires manual deallocation.  I don't know enough about the Windows syscall package,
but it's conceivable that on Windows the syscall package will need to provide a function
to allocate pinned memory, again with manual deallocation.

This is related to issue #8310.
